chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
r_transitive bool lem

Premises:
r_transitive : forall A : Set, mRelation A -> Prop
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
lem_antisymmetric = fun x : Map bool => Map_ind bool (fun x0 : Map bool => forall y : Map bool, lem x0 y -> lem y x0 -> x0 = y) (fun y : Map bool => Map_ind bool (fun y0 : Map bool => lem (M0 bool) y0 -> lem y0 (M0 bool) -> M0 bool = y0) (fun _ _ : lem (M0 bool) (M0 bool) => eq_refl) (fun (a : ad) (a0 : bool) (H : lem (M0 bool) (M1 bool a a0)) (_ : lem (M1 bool a a0) (M0 bool)) => False_ind (M0 bool = M1 bool a a0) H) (fun (m : Map bool) (_ : lem (M0 bool) m -> lem m (M0 bool) -> M0 bool = m) (m0 : Map bool) (_ : lem (M0 bool) m0 -> lem m0 (M0 bool) -> M0 bool...
lem_reflexive = fun x : Map bool => Map_ind bool (fun x0 : Map bool => lem x0 x0) I (fun (a : ad) (a0 : bool) => eq_ind_r (fun b : bool => if b then leb a0 a0 else False) (leb_reflexive a0) (N.eqb_refl a)) (fun (m : Map bool) (H : lem m m) (m0 : Map bool) (H0 : lem m0 m0) => conj H H0) x : r_reflexive bool lem
lem = fix lem (m0 m1 : Map bool) {struct m1} : Prop := match m0 with | @M0 _ => match m1 with | @M0 _ => True | _ => False end | @M1 _ a b => match m1 with | @M1 _ a' b' => if (a =? a')%N then leb b b' else False | _ => False end | @M2 _ a b => match m1 with | @M2 _ c d => lem a c /\ lem b d | _ => False end end : Map bool -> Map bool -> Prop
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii For Ascii: Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope]
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
implb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else true : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
andb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else false : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
orb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then true else b2 : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
negb = fun b : bool => if b then false else true : bool -> bool Argument scope is [bool_scope]
Bvector.Bsign : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool (S n) -> bool
leb = fun b0 b1 : bool => if b0 then if b1 then True else False else if b1 then True else True : bool -> bool -> Prop Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
is_true = fun b : bool => b = true : bool -> Prop Argument scope is [bool_scope]
Nat.b2n = fun b : bool => if b then 1 else 0 : bool -> nat Argument scope is [bool_scope]
BinInt.Z.b2z = fun b : bool => if b then Zpos 1 else Z0 : bool -> Z Argument scope is [bool_scope]
N.odd_0 = eq_ind (negb (N.even 0)) (fun b : bool => b = false) (eq_ind_r (fun b : bool => negb b = false) eq_refl N.even_0) (N.odd 0) (N.negb_even 0) : N.odd 0 = false
Init.Nat.even = fix even (n : nat) : bool := match n with | 0 => true | 1 => false | S (S n') => even n' end : nat -> bool Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.testbit = fix testbit (a n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => Init.Nat.odd a | S n0 => testbit (Init.Nat.div2 a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> bool Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
ZMicromega.Zunsat = RingMicromega.check_inconsistent Z0 Zbool.Zeq_bool BinInt.Z.leb : RingMicromega.NFormula Z -> bool
in_dom : forall A : Type, ad -> Map A -> bool
Bvector.Bvector = Vector.t bool : nat -> Set Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.leb = fix leb (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => true | S n' => match m with | 0 => false | S m' => leb n' m' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem = fix mem (i : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt) (m : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) {struct m} : bool := match m with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => false | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l o r => match i with | (i0~1)%positive => mem i0 r | (i0~0)%positive => mem i0 l | 1%positive => o end end : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> bool
BinNatDef.N.odd = fun n : N => negb (BinNatDef.N.even n) : N -> bool Argument scope is [N_scope]
Init.Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Init.Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Argument scope is [nat_scope]
bool_ind : forall P : bool -> Prop, P true -> P false -> forall b : bool, P b

```coq
unfold r_transitive.
intros x y z Hxy Hyz.
induction x using Map_ind; destruct y using Map_ind; destruct z using Map_ind.
- simpl in *. intros _ _; auto.
- simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto.
- simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto.
- simpl in *. intros H1 H2; destruct (N.eqb_spec a a'); destruct (N.eqb_spec b b'); subst; auto.
- simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto.
- simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto.
- simpl in *. intros H1 H2; destruct (lem_reflexive a) as [Ha _]; destruct (lem_reflexive b) as [Hb _]; destruct (lem_reflexive c) as [Hc _]; destruct (lem_reflexive d) as [Hd _]; auto.
Qed.```

original: unfold r_transitive. intros x y z Hxy Hyz. induction x using Map_ind; destruct y using Map_ind; destruct z using Map_ind. - simpl in *. intros _ _; auto. - simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto. - simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto. - simpl in *. intros H1 H2; destruct (N.eqb_spec a a'); destruct (N.eqb_spec b b'); subst; auto. - simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto. - simpl in *. intros H1 H2; exfalso; auto. - simpl in *. intros H1 H2; destruct (lem_reflexive a) as [Ha _]; destruct (lem_reflexive b) as [Hb _]; destruct (lem_reflexive c) as [Hc _]; destruct (lem_reflexive d) as [Hd _]; auto.
